title: The Empire's Reach
opening: An ominous wave of dark creatures washes over the continent… Eirika’s journey to find her brother, Ephraim, grows ever more perilous. Still, she presses on despite the danger. Her will is strong. The town of Serafew, located on the border of Renais and Grado. The people of both countries have long used the town as a meeting place. It stands as testimony to the friendship the two nations have shared these many years. Now, however, Serafew is teeming with Grado troops.

intro.speaker: Joshua
intro.line: Well, well. There’s an arena in this town. Perfect. My pocket’s feeling a bit light. Say, is that a cleric? It is! And a gorgeous one at that.

intro.speaker: Joshua
intro.line: Something amiss, Sister? You look flustered.

intro.speaker: Natasha
intro.line: Ahhh! P-pardon me.

intro.speaker: Joshua
intro.line: No, pardon me! I never meant to startle you. May I offer my apologies....

intro.speaker: Natasha
intro.line: No, it’s not necessary... It was my fault. Excuse me, I must be going... Good day to you.

intro.speaker: Joshua
intro.line: ...And there she goes. Not my lucky day... She was quite the beauty, too. Ah, such is life. I think I’ve time still to visit the arena, though.

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: Captain Saar of the Serafew Border Guard. How fare you? I bring orders from His Majesty. Rumor has it that Princess Eirika of Renais is making her way to Grado. You are to find her and to place her in custody immediately.

intro.speaker: Saar
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: One more thing... A traitor to the empire has fled Castle Grado. We’ve received reports she is hiding somewhere here in Serafew. I don’t care if you have to tear this town apart. Find the turncoat.

intro.speaker: Saar
intro.line: Yes, sir, General Glen! If she resists, do we have permission to execute her?

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: ...Yes. Permission granted.

intro.speaker: Saar
intro.line: Understood! Grado’s will be done. The Grado Empire will repay the debt of betrayal with blood!

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: ...His Majesty relies upon you, Captain. Be sure his trust is not misplaced. That is all.

intro.speaker: Saar
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: Such loyalty to the crown. If only I could hold such conviction in the righteousness of our emperor.

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: Something troubling you, Brother?

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: No...Pay no mind to me. Come, Cormag. Let’s go. From here, we ride northeast, back to the fort.

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: Very well.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: It’s been so long since I last visited Serafew. My brother and I used to pass through here en route to Grado. I remember the harmony in which the people of both countries lived. No walls divided our borders. No soldiers stood guard in high towers. The border town... It was to me a symbol of the trust between Grado and Renais.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: ...And now, it is firmly under the thumb of Grado’s emperor.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: The peace I remember in this city... It seems like something from another time. It seems lost now... Forever.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: ...The city doesn’t seem to be very heavily patrolled. They must feel it’s not worth guarding with Castle Renais under their control. We must try to not draw attention to ourselves. The west gate is undermanned....

intro.speaker: Saleh
intro.line: Pardon me, may I ask you a question?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: What is it?

intro.speaker: Saleh
intro.line: I’m looking for someone. Have you seen a young girl with indigo hair?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Indigo hair? No...Sorry.

intro.speaker: Saleh
intro.line: Hmmm... Thank you. Sorry to intrude.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: There was something very odd about that man, wouldn’t you say?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: He did seem unusual. He didn’t strike me as a Grado spy, but...

intro.speaker: Soldiers
intro.line: Catch her! Don’t let her escape! That way! She went that way!

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: What’s that?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: It’s coming from over there.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Let’s see what the commotion is.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Traitor Natasha! Surrender peacefully. Come quietly, and you may have the chance to explain yourself before His Majesty.

intro.speaker: Natasha
intro.line: Wait, please. You must listen to me!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Take her.

intro.speaker: Natasha
intro.line: No, you must believe me! The emperor is not himself. You MUST be able to see that!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Impugn the emperor at your peril! We’ve been ordered to execute you if you offer any resistance. But your words condemn you!

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: That cleric is a traitor to the throne of Grado? What madness is this?

intro.speaker: Natasha
intro.line: Ah...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Are you all right?

intro.speaker: Natasha
intro.line: Who are you?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: I’m from Renais. Why are these Grado men after you?

intro.speaker: Natasha
intro.line: You’re from Renais...Oh! I have something I must tell you. It’s about Grado–

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Wait–Grado soldiers are coming this way. We’ll have to talk later. Now we must fight!

battle.speaker: Joshua
battle.line: So much for my dreams of making my fortune here... First the girl, now the gold. It really isn’t my lucky day.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: You there! Mercenary! What are you doing here at the arena? Get back to the staging area now!

battle.speaker: Joshua
battle.line: C’mon, why don’t we both hit the arena? It’ll be good training, If you’re going to risk your life anyway, you may as well try to earn some gold.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: I’m reporting you to the captain! You’ll be lucky if he just docks your pay! Don’t forget–You can be replaced in an eyeblink, you filthy sellsword!

battle.speaker: Joshua
battle.line: Don’t worry, little man. I won’t forget. Work’s work, but I don’t like fighting women... Now then, what’s the rest of the day got in store for me? ...Tails huh? That’s nothing but bad luck and more bad luck...

battle.speaker: Natasha
battle.line: They may not want to hear what I have to say, but... I must speak with one of the Grado soldiers. Oh, if only one of them will listen to my words... Please! Grant me strength.

battle.speaker: Brigand
battle.line: Look at this. Now’s our chance! C’mon, lads! Let’s join the fights and steal our way through this pathetic town!

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: In my youth, I was a knight of some renown, I’ll have you know. I’ve even crossed blades with one of Grado’s most famous generals, I have. Ah, but I’m an old man now... I’m starting to worry... What if I die without passing on my techniques? So I decided to write down what I’ve learned in a book. I have it here. You seem like a strong warrior. I’d be honored if you would accept it.

visit.speaker: Amelia
visit.line: Hope everyone’ well back home in Silva. Just a bit more, and I’ll be in the empire. Let’s see, I’ve got vulneraries, antitoxins... Oh! And I can’t let myself forget torches for when it gets dark. Yep! I’m all set! Now I just need to get to the capital. I’ll be the finest soldier the Grado army’s ever seen! I swear it!

recruit-talk.speaker: Natasha
recruit-talk.line: You...You’re that man I met... Are you here to capture me? You’ve been hired to silence me, haven’t you...

recruit-talk.speaker: Joshua
recruit-talk.line: Yeah, Grado’s paying the bill. They want you dead, you know? But don’t feel bad. It’s not personal.

recruit-talk.speaker: Natasha
recruit-talk.line: Wait, please... It doesn’t matter what happens to me, but you must hear my words. The emperor of Grado is changed. He is not the man he once was. The other nations must be warned before he extinguishes all light from out lands.

recruit-talk.speaker: Joshua
recruit-talk.line: Hey, no offense, but I’m just a mercenary. I don’t care about Grado or its emperor. Everything you say may be true, or it may be lies. I don’t care either way.

recruit-talk.speaker: Joshua
recruit-talk.line: Even so...killing a beautiful lady like you would leave a bad taste in my mouth. Tell me, do you like to gamble?

recruit-talk.speaker: Joshua
recruit-talk.line: Gambling’s what I live for. Even when I lose, I never want to stop. Let’s have us a little wager. If you win, I’ll believe you. Heads or tails, you call it.

recruit-talk.speaker: Natasha
recruit-talk.line: You can’t... This is no time for games...

recruit-talk.speaker: Joshua
recruit-talk.line: Would you rather I get on with the job I was hired for?

recruit-talk.speaker: Joshua
recruit-talk.line: All right. So I’m heads, and you’re tails. Here we go. ... ... ...

recruit-talk.speaker: Joshua
recruit-talk.line: What do you know?! It’s tails. You win. Figures. I haven’t won anything all day. Well, Lady Luck has spoken. Guess I’m on your side now.

recruit-talk.speaker: Joshua
recruit-talk.line: Yeah. Sure, I might cheat, but I never worm out of a bet. It’s a rule of mine.

recruit-talk.speaker: Natasha
recruit-talk.line: Oh, thank heaven! Thank you, blessed light, for your protection!

recruit-talk.speaker: Joshua
recruit-talk.line: I got nothing against heaven, but I’m right here if you want someone to thank... No? Well , get behind me then. I’ve got to take care of these fools.

boss.speaker: Saar
boss.line: Enemy of the empire! Death’s too good for you!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: That was a tight spot.

end.speaker: Natasha
end.line: Yes, yes it was... Thank you so much. I don’t know how to repay–

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: You’re from Grado, aren’t you?

end.speaker: Natasha
end.line: Yes... My name is Natasha. I was a servant of the people at Grado’s Imperial Temple.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Then why the trouble with the soldiers? Would you tell us your story?

end.speaker: Natasha
end.line: Of course... A few days past, my mentor was arrested without warning. They executed him. They said he as a traitor... But those were false accusations. The emperor had him killed–a holy man!–to keep him silent.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Keep him silent?

end.speaker: Natasha
end.line: Yes. My mentor told me with his final breath. The emperor plans to destroy the Sacred Stones.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: The Sacred Stones? Destroy them?

end.speaker: Natasha
end.line: As you must know, the Sacred Stones drove back the power of evil long ago. Even now, each of our nations is home to one of these legendary treasures. There’s one in my homeland, Grado, and one in your Renais...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes, the Sacred Stone of Renais is still housed in our royal temple.

end.speaker: Natasha
end.line: The emperor plans to destroy the five stones, one by one...

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Why would he do such a thing? Legend says the Sacred Stones are even now all that keep evil at bay!

end.speaker: Natasha
end.line: I cannot begin to guess his motives... You must know, our emperor was a gentle man. But one day, he changed. Utterly. Before my mentor died, he said the keepers of the Sacred Stones must be warned. I tried to slip across the border, but the soldiers spotted me...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Is that what happened... What do you think, Seth?

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: I think we can trust no one from Grado. Not in these times. Not without proof. However, if what she says is true, we cannot ignore the danger we face. Destroying the Sacred Stones... We cannot allow that to happen.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I agree. If only we knew if there were some reason for the emperor’s actions. I must tell you, her story chills me to the bone. I pray it is false...

end.speaker: Man
end.line: A moment, please. Are you perchance... Princess Eirika?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I am.

end.speaker: Man
end.line: Oh... Thank goodness you’re safe! I can’t tell you how happy I am. And please accept my gratitude for driving off that Captain Saar. That Saar treated all the citizens of Renais with such contempt and brutality....

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Not here...not in this city. My brother and I spent such happy times here with Lyon...

end.speaker: Man
end.line: I beg your pardon, but it will not be long before Grado sends more troops. Please, you must go quickly.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I’m so sorry. There’s nothing I can do for you now. Please forgive me.

end.speaker: Man
end.line: Do not be troubled. Princess Eirika... We will survive and wait for the day of liberation to come. There will be a day when you, Prince Ephraim, and all of Renais rise up... Until that day of glory comes, we will wait unbowed and filled with hope.
